meta.description: A program for automatically building non-source files from sources
meta.name: gnumake

meta.description: GNU Make, a program controlling the generation of non-source files from sources
meta.long_description:
Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
        other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

        Make gets its knowledge of how to build your program from a file
        called the makefile, which lists each of the non-source files and
        how to compute it from other files. When you write a program, you
        should write a makefile for it, so that it is possible to use Make
        to build and install the program.
meta.name: gnumake

meta.description: A tool to control the generation of non-source files from sources
